author: heinz.gassner
title: Establish SPO 2.0 Blueprint
description: Cardano cuenta con un número impresionante de OPS, pero no todas tienen éxito. También hay una fuerte narrativa de que es demasiado tarde para empezar

f6_assessments.q0: This solution is intending to create a blueprint conform with EU-law where new SPOs can start operations from with confidence that they are safe from prosecution. So the proposal does not create new business opportunities, rather it facilitates new start ups in a safe environment. These legal protection mechanisms are much needed in a rapidly expanding ecosystem. It mitigates risks and promotes consistency.
f6_assessments.q1: DLT360 has a heavy focus on legislative frameworks that are currently high in demand. The team has been well documented along with evidence of their competencies. The budget has been broken down to realistic standards.
f6_assessments.q2: Very structured variables to track progress after funding. The approach is correct and contains all that is needed without bloating the proposal and retaining structure.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I know how important decentralised communities are for democratic and economic empowerment, which also applies to decentralized and partially mission-driven stakepools, especially regarding the economic part. This knowledge and my knowledge about mission driven stakepools enables me to provide valuable insights for this challenge. The proposal identifies a legitimate problem, the lack off accessibility to creating a stakepool, the legal difficulties with it and the resulting increasing centralisation of stakepools. By providing a solution that facilitates becoming an SPO within local regulations, the proposal can have a lot of positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem by fostering decentralisation. Hence, the key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings
and the proposal will help with future scalability.
f6_assessments.q1:
DLT360 has so far shown (with their proposal from F6 they currently govern) that they are a serious and competent project partner for catalyst. I is highly likely that they are up for the challenge. The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and present them transparently. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable and roadmap to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is a great example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Well-defined, detailed metrics and an auditable roadmap are presented that define the success of the proposal. A clear, understandable problem description is accompanied by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution.

f6_assessments.q0: The SPO 2.0 blueprint answers the challenge of encouraging people to start SPOs by learning & networking quite well. The SPOs should be nourished to grow from the ground up without leaving anyone behind. Promoting the decentralisation is a key that voters should bear in mind when it comes to this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer team is comprised of veteran with leadership experience and strong consultation skill. The budget is allocated to different parties although some items need more elaboration as two items are not very clear (rate per hour, number of hours). The budget looks plausible but will be beneficial to the community to seek which part should be adjusted to be in line with the market rate.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal detail has been classified into identifiable items for ease of impact, feasibility and auditability assessment. Note that the proposal end results (12 months after funding) is for the SPOs to adopt the blueprint. There are a few questions on whether the blueprint will be open source or would it belong to DLT360 consulting service.  The logic seems right to nurture the growth of SPOs. The primary client of this proposals are mixed of individuals and organisations. However, the priority should be given to individuals rather than organisations to establish SPOs as mentioned in the impact assessment that decentralisation is a key point that we should all bear in mind when it comes to SPOs.

solution: Demostraremos que no es demasiado tarde para empezar como SPO. Teniendo en cuenta los aprendizajes, el trabajo en red y la experiencia, crearemos un plan de SPO 2.0
experience: Más de 30 años de experiencia en el sector junto con un equipo central flexible y una red de expertos de renombre
